newsitem.title: GERMANY: German businessman sees no French strike impact.
newsitem.headline: German businessman sees no French strike impact.

text.p: The French truckers' strike has had no significant impact on trade with Germany, Cornel Renfert, head of the German-French Chamber of Commerce, said on Thursday.
"German-French trade relations have, in principle, not been affected by this strike," Renfert said on German radio.
There have been some individual bottlenecks, but the statistical effect on the annual trade volume is likely to be under 0.5 percent, Renfert said.
Thousands of German truckers have been stranded for days in France by the strike, as French drivers blockaded the borders to bring commerce to a standstill.

But Renfert said the strike, now in its 11th day, has still been too short to have grave consequences. If the strike were to continue another week, however, it could have a serious impact on the import-export business, he said.
France's conservative government ended mediation efforts with the truckers on Thursday, declaring victory and urging the truckers to return to work.
